title: How to create an original, unique, deep, and fantasy novel - Quora

response.answer_text: How can you create an original, unique, deep, and fantasy novel? Let’s face it - your fantasy novel can only be as original, unique and deep as you are. Don’t stick to the cliches, don’t try too hard at being unique, and write about what you want to write. In short, be yourself. And you’ll get a novel that is as original, unique and deep as you are. If you are a special person, you’ll get a special novel. If you’re a boring person, you’ll get a boring novel (the sort that become bestsellers among people who haven’t seen it all a million times). If you happen to be a neurotypical protestant heterosexual white male, and aren’t confident in your specialness, you’ll need to work on yourself. Don’t worry, I’m not telling you to participate in satanic gay orgies. Instead, you should acquire wisdom. Listen to all the different viewpoints and worldviews.Educate yourself on all sorts of political ideologies and philosophical systems.Do research on obscure topics.Get an education or a profession if you don’t have one already (all writers are writers, but reading a physicist writer is different from reading a linguist writer).Once you have your unique insight you want to share with the world, you are ready to write something unique. It will take practice (probably a lot of practice) to make your novel actually interesting, but originality is about being true to yourself.

Don’t worry about any of this. You would not be asking this question if you had ever written a book yourself. Before you can even hope to pull something like this off, you need practice. About a million words of practice. Right now you are someone who just bought their first pair of figure skates, showing up to your National Olympic Skating Association and saying “Put me on the team!” when you can’t even skate two strokes without falling on your ass. Just write a book. Rewrite it until your eyes bleed. Rewrite it some more with the help of a professional editor. Then write another. And another. By the time you get those million words of practice in, you’ll be able to answer that question for yourself.
